file_content.text: Let my partner at the Republic outpost know how the op's going. He'll be taking over from here.
Use plenty of Thul gas grenades against those Baliss soldiers. Did I say that too loud?
With a few canisters of that gas, House Thul could conquer the Republic-friendly houses in a few weeks.
Leaving no one to resist them.
People who are affected by this gas. Do they recover?
Is the gas fatal?
I could have used a gas like that to get out of a few scrapes.
Sounds very handy.
I'm obviously not associated with either House Thul or House Baliss. They'll realize this is a setup.
They won't be fooled.
Shush! Don't draw attention to me, okay?
Hmm. Big team, increases the risk of security leaks. Still, can't be too picky.
A Jedi. Good. Good. Someone I can trust to keep quiet. I can, right?
You. Soldier. What's your clearance? You authorized for classified ops?
Who're you? Spacer, right? Huh. I guess money can buy a lot of no questions.
Agent Shyrack, SIS--no, act normal. I'm after House Thul, those Imperial toadies. They have a new weapon I'd like to see gone.
Thul ordered their vassal, House Baliss, to develop a special nerve gas. Can knock out a whole palace of people in minutes, silently.
Keep your voice down! Yes, exactly. We need to turn their advantage into ours.
Reports are sketchy. Unconsciousness, nausea, lethargy, no reported deaths in testing. Yet.
It's not a toy! It's--see this gas in action, you'll understand.
You need that gas destroyed.
War brings new weapons. So?
Thul's field-testing the nerve gas today. And House Baliss is doing military exercises. This is a chance to turn them against each other.
If someone--say, you--got hold of Thul's gas grenades, and used them against Baliss soldiers, both houses will start hurling accusations. Allowing us to hit their gas stockpiles.
That's a good cause. I'm in.
True, they'll catch on. Eventually. But all we need is a few days of infighting.
Find the Thul soldiers using the gas grenades. Take the grenades and stage an attack on Baliss' forces--look, they're stationed here, and here.
When you're done, report in to my partner at the Republic outpost. Discreetly. We need to move against those gas stockpiles fast.
No, thanks. [Refuse quest]
Then don't tell anyone we spoke, all right? And forget I said that, too.
